title: See the White House forever changed by these major overhauls
shortDescription: The White House has undergone major renovations since it's construction in 1792.The biggest was between 1948-1952 when it was completely gutted.

title: Federal government shutdown continues as Trump rebuffs Democrats.
shortDescription: The president turned down a meeting with Democratic leadership until the government reopens as the shutdown continues for the 22nd day.

title: Trump pick for whistleblower office withdraws after racist texts report
shortDescription: Paul Ingrassia said he is withdrawing "because unfortunately I do not have enough Republican votes at this time."

title: Trump's meeting with Putin in Budapest canceled
shortDescription: President Trump initially made plans for a meeting with Putin to work on an agreement to end the war with Ukraine. The summit was canceled days later.

title: Trump seeks compensation from DOJ
shortDescription: President Donald Trump responded to a report he's seeking compensation from the Department of Justice. He said he'd donate any awarded damages.

title: Trump admin considering a change for who runs special education
shortDescription: The potential move would represent one of the most significant steps yet in President Trump's bid to decrease the Education Department's influence.

title: Biden rings bell to mark radiation therapy complete
shortDescription: Former President Joe Biden celebrated his completion of radiation therapy with family and doctors after being diagnosed with a form of prostate cancer.

title: Trump asking Justice Department to pay him $230 million, report says
shortDescription: Trump has submitted two complaints seeking compensation through an administrative claims process, according to the New York Times.

title: Rand Paul pokes back at Trump after snub from White House reception
shortDescription: Sen. Rand Paul of Kentucky tried to get the last laugh after getting left out of a White House reception for Republican senators.

title: House GOP refers Obama CIA chief for prosecution
shortDescription: Judiciary Chair Jim Jordan said Brennan lied to Congress about an investigation into whether Russia intervened in the 2016 election to help Trump.

title: Hegseth clamps down on military communications with Congress
shortDescription: The move aims to ensure that the Pentagon chief controls the military's message on Capitol Hill.

title: Will history be on the side of the Dems for the midterms?
shortDescription: Democrats are issuing a call to action to seemingly try to regain popularity as the midterm elections approach.

title: Judge to block Trump policy targeting 'gender ideology' in schools
shortDescription: A federal judge said she will block the Trump administration from forcing Democrat-led states to remove all references to "gender ideology" from sexual health curricula to receive federal grant funding.

title: 'Music to my ears': Trump praises East Wing demolition
shortDescription: President Trump commented on the sounds of his latest White House renovation as workers began demolishing part of the East Wing for his new ballroom.

title: Trump's summit with Putin in Budapest is suddenly off
shortDescription: President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin are no longer meeting in Budapest as was announced just last week.

title: Watch live: Demolition work begins on the East Wing of the White House
shortDescription: The construction is part of President Donald Trump's plan to build a ballroom on the eastern side of the White House.

title: 'Music to my ears': Trump loves the sound of East Wing demolition
shortDescription: Donors to the ballroom construction include huge U.S. corporations, such as Lockheed Martin, Palantir, Alphabetâ€™s Google, Meta and Amazon.

title: Biden completes radiation therapy after cancer diagnosis, rings bell
shortDescription: Biden's daughter posted an Instagram video of her father at Penn Medicine ringing a bell, which is done to mark the end of a cancer treatment.

title: Racist text report jeopardizes Trump nominee to whistleblower office
shortDescription: The president's nominee to lead a key office that protects federal workers has come under increasing scrutiny.
